Legal_Issue: Whether the court has jurisdiction to issue a stay of tribunal proceedings under the Federal Court Act
Procedural_Context: Judicial review application seeking interim relief
Legal_Provision: s. 18.2, s. 57 of the Federal Court Act
Basis_of_Claim: Denial of opportunity to raise constitutional arguments due to lack of notice under s. 57
Key_Factor_in_Determination: No irreparable harm shown; tribunal retains jurisdiction to address issues
Application_Error: Failure to provide notice to Attorneys General under s. 57 for constitutional arguments
Review_Outcome: Stay denied; tribunal proceedings allowed to continue
Legal_Standard: Interim relief under s. 18.2 requires showing of irreparable harm
Application_Factor: Timeliness of notice for constitutional issues
Decision_Outcome: Tribunal may proceed; judicial review rights preserved
Decision_Review_Issue: Jurisdiction to grant stay pending judicial review
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: s. 18.2 and s. 57, Federal Court Act
Cause_of_Refusal: No irreparable harm; procedural compliance lacking for constitutional claims
Procedural_Fairness: Tribunal adjourned due to lack of notice under s. 57
Jurisdictional_Focus: Federal Court jurisdiction over tribunal proceedings
Procedural_Issue: Requirement to notify Attorneys General under s. 57 for constitutional challenges
